intro: Swartzia conferta, commonly known as the yellowwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae), characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The tree can grow up to 25 meters tall, with a straight trunk and dense, dark green foliage. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, while the wood is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. Swartzia conferta plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
